channel.title: People don't load anything when they run my client
channel.description: Ok so, I have finished everything up to the point when people run my client. I have portforwarded I know because I used canyouseeme and I use an rsps server checker and it said it was online, I have my public client set to my no-ip address but no one can connect but when I use the no ip client it acts as if I use my local host client. What do I do to fix this?

item.title: People don't load anything when they run my client
item.dc:creator: @ItsNateDuh ItsNateDuh
item.description:
@ItsNateDuh wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Search your client for the name Guardian718 and replace it with your name where it applies. The folder may be getting created by the client when it’s trying to find the cache and see’s it doesn’t exist

I have done that, but it still will not load, I found “guardian” folders but that’s all I could find because I did what you said before you replied.

Read full topic
item.source: People don't load anything when they run my client

item.title: People don't load anything when they run my client
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Search your client for the name Guardian718 and replace it with your name where it applies. The folder may be getting created by the client when it’s trying to find the cache and see’s it doesn’t exist

Read full topic
item.source: People don't load anything when they run my client

item.title: People don't load anything when they run my client
item.dc:creator: @ItsNateDuh ItsNateDuh
item.description:
@ItsNateDuh wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:546019”][quote author=ItsNateDuh link=topic=664905.msg4445429#msg4445429 date=1408544338]

You’ll still have a similar method somewhere in the client.

What is a method I don’t know what that is

I wouldn’t know.
Check your C:\ drive for the cache or your user home, which on windows 7 is C:\Users\YourComputerUsername\Cachename.
That’s typically how I find it if I don’t know it.
From there search the name in your client folder, and it should show all the files that have it’s name in it.
Figure out which one has the method that returns the string with the cache name. Now you both know where the cache is so you can rename it, and you can also change the name of it for the client to load if you want. Just remember you have to change it in any file that doesn’t get the cache name from that method (you can always make it get it from that method)

In my settings.java the it has a dir to the main cache I changed that then I compiled but it did nothing, it worked though
[/quote]

It did nothing
It worked though.
Those 2 statements go against each other…
Anyways, it’s good to see it worked. Make sure the directory is not OS based. Mac (i believe) and Linux don’t have the C:\ drive like windows by default, so if it’s trying to load from there I’d recommend changing it to user.home[/quote]
I have found the Guardian718 folder which is the default name, then I found the user.home and I have changed the Guardian718 with my cache name, compiled it, ran it but it still loaded as Guardian718 instead of my cache name
return System.getProperty(“user.home”) + “/Vileturmoilcache/guardian/live”;

Read full topic
item.source: People don't load anything when they run my client

item.title: People don't load anything when they run my client
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ItsNateDuh, post:9, topic:546019”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664905.msg4445405#msg4445405 date=1408509768]

You’ll still have a similar method somewhere in the client.

What is a method I don’t know what that is

I wouldn’t know.
Check your C:\ drive for the cache or your user home, which on windows 7 is C:\Users\YourComputerUsername\Cachename.
That’s typically how I find it if I don’t know it.
From there search the name in your client folder, and it should show all the files that have it’s name in it.
Figure out which one has the method that returns the string with the cache name. Now you both know where the cache is so you can rename it, and you can also change the name of it for the client to load if you want. Just remember you have to change it in any file that doesn’t get the cache name from that method (you can always make it get it from that method)
[/quote]
In my settings.java the it has a dir to the main cache I changed that then I compiled but it did nothing, it worked though[/quote]

It did nothing
It worked though.
Those 2 statements go against each other…
Anyways, it’s good to see it worked. Make sure the directory is not OS based. Mac (i believe) and Linux don’t have the C:\ drive like windows by default, so if it’s trying to load from there I’d recommend changing it to user.home

Read full topic
item.source: People don't load anything when they run my client

item.title: People don't load anything when they run my client
item.dc:creator: @ItsNateDuh ItsNateDuh
item.description:
@ItsNateDuh wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:546019”][quote author=ItsNateDuh link=topic=664905.msg4445395#msg4445395 date=1408507013]

You’ll still have a similar method somewhere in the client.

What is a method I don’t know what that is
[/quote]
I wouldn’t know.
Check your C:\ drive for the cache or your user home, which on windows 7 is C:\Users\YourComputerUsername\Cachename.
That’s typically how I find it if I don’t know it.
From there search the name in your client folder, and it should show all the files that have it’s name in it.
Figure out which one has the method that returns the string with the cache name. Now you both know where the cache is so you can rename it, and you can also change the name of it for the client to load if you want. Just remember you have to change it in any file that doesn’t get the cache name from that method (you can always make it get it from that method)[/quote]
In my settings.java the it has a dir to the main cache I changed that then I compiled but it did nothing, it worked though

Read full topic
item.source: People don't load anything when they run my client

item.title: People don't load anything when they run my client
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ItsNateDuh, post:7, topic:546019”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664905.msg4445084#msg4445084 date=1408326886]
You’ll still have a similar method somewhere in the client.
[/quote]
What is a method I don’t know what that is[/quote]
I wouldn’t know.
Check your C:\ drive for the cache or your user home, which on windows 7 is C:\Users\YourComputerUsername\Cachename.
That’s typically how I find it if I don’t know it.
From there search the name in your client folder, and it should show all the files that have it’s name in it.
Figure out which one has the method that returns the string with the cache name. Now you both know where the cache is so you can rename it, and you can also change the name of it for the client to load if you want. Just remember you have to change it in any file that doesn’t get the cache name from that method (you can always make it get it from that method)

Read full topic

item.source: People don't load anything when they run my client

item.title: People don't load anything when they run my client
item.dc:creator: @ItsNateDuh ItsNateDuh
item.description:
@ItsNateDuh wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:546019”][quote author=ItsNateDuh link=topic=664905.msg4445062#msg4445062 date=1408322810]

Rename your cache folder, where ever it’s located. Doesn’t matter what name.
After you’ve renamed it, run the jar that you give to other people. Make sure to run it with a .bat (for debugging, yo).
Post errors.

Do I change the cache name in the source folder or the data folder?
[/quote]
You change the cache name where ever it’s downloaded at. Look in signlink.java in your client if you have it.
There should be a method like “findcachedir” that returns a string. Rename the cache found at that location.[/quote]
I do not have a signlink, I use a 718 client

Read full topic
item.source: People don't load anything when they run my client

item.title: People don't load anything when they run my client
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ItsNateDuh, post:3, topic:546019”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664905.msg4444973#msg4444973 date=1408304559]
Rename your cache folder, where ever it’s located. Doesn’t matter what name.
After you’ve renamed it, run the jar that you give to other people. Make sure to run it with a .bat (for debugging, yo).
Post errors.
[/quote]
Do I change the cache name in the source folder or the data folder?[/quote]
You change the cache name where ever it’s downloaded at. Look in signlink.java in your client if you have it.
There should be a method like “findcachedir” that returns a string. Rename the cache found at that location.

Read full topic
